Reliance Jio Infocomm Ltd. said the telecom regulator’s decision to slash interconnect usage charge by more than half to 6 paise benefits users and not the country’s newest telecom operator.“There is no question of any advantage from the new IUC regulation to Jio as it has already passed on all the benefits to customers,” the Mukesh Ambani-led firm said in a statement. With the cost of voice calls coming down to a fraction of a paisa, customers should be able to enjoy this relief, it said.The operator had demanded that IUC, or fees companies earn to complete calls originating from rivals’ networks, should be abolished. Reliance Jio doesn’t earn from its customers for calls as it offers voice services free. It has to pay rivals for calls the company’s subscribers make to other networks. Moreover, larger rivals like Bharti Airtel, with deeper rural networks, see significantly higher incoming traffic and are net IUC earners, Kotak Institutional Equities said in a July report.The incumbent operators criticised the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India’s decision, and industry body Cellular Operators Association of India said it will challenge the IUC cut in court. Bharti Airtel Ltd., India’s largest operator, had earlier said Reliance Jio’s proposal to abolish the charges would allow the Mukesh Ambani-led company to price services in a predatory manner to monopolise and “kill the industry”.

Reliance Jio said its older rivals “have a history of opposing all the IUC regulations over the last 8 years, but have not been successful in thwarting passing of the benefits... to customers”.“References to financial stress in the industry or the need for IUC to promote rural coverage again shows the attitude of the incumbent operators wherein IUC is being treated as a subsidy that the Indian customers must pay to sustain these operators financially,” Reliance Jio said. “On the contrary, it is a fact that the high-cost IUC regime thus far has caused financial stress for the smaller and new operators.”Reliance Jio backed TRAI’s decision to abolish the charges from 2020. That will help make mobile phone services more affordable for Indian customers, it said.
title: Reliance Jio Says Lower Interconnect Charge Benefits Users, Not The Company
